threats.title: User modifying request to get information that it's not allowed
Authentication Compromised
Attacker uses old Token
Wrong code is posted into production
threats.description: This refers that somebody from outside is able to insert code in some part of the source code.

threats.title: Attacker uses FTP to modify code
threats.mitigation: - PS lock down access control list
threats.description: Someone could upload or modify any existing file on the source of the application, allowing to do anything on the site.

threats.title: Backdoor inside source code
threats.description: A developers add a backdoor to allow inappropriate access to the system.

threats.title: Vulnerable 3rd party Library
Activity Logging
threats.mitigation:
- Log to external location
- Not logging enough

threats.title: Somebody modify the source code from a parallel software application on the server
An attacker can modify the data inside the database from a parallel software application
Somebody make application unavailble from the server.
User Spoof Azure Authentication
SQL Injection
Data not encrypted over public network
threats.description: The information for Authentication or other data is not encrypted.

threats.title: XSS Attack
CSRF Attack
threats.mitigation:
- Review HTML Headers
- Secure your Cookies

threats.title: User denies creating inapropriate content
A user can elevate privilege to get information
User Redirected to an alternative Server
Data not encrypted over public network
Backend Database changes
User access the wrong/inappropriate data
threats.description: An attacker's direct access results in accessing confidential client data

threats.title: Production Support denies manualy changing data records
threats.description: A user from the production suppor team do a change on the database directly without required any type of credentials because the Ad admins can access every place.

threats.title: User Redirected to an alternative Server
threats.description: A user can redirect the request to an alternative server to get access.

threats.title: Attacker uses some sort of DDOS to prevent access to this website
threats.description:
This could include a different sort of attacks like:
Brute force attack
Bot Net Attack
Heavy SQL query
Anything that could take the system unresponsive.

threats.title: Attacker cause the server to fail it's using a old version of software
threats.description: Some of the un updated software present on the server could allows to an attacker to gain access to the server and take it offline.

threats.title: An attacker can modify or purge log entries
threats.mitigation: We are using text files instead of database to reduce the access to the logs.

threats.title: An Attacker can read the database credentials.
threats.mitigation: Encript the connection string inside the web.config file.
